commit.message: RDM-9120 -  minor refactoring for remove case user role
RDM-9120 -  feature file update as per discussion
RDM-9120 - added FTA for one more happy path
RDM-9120 - Added S-111.3 FTA negative scenario
RDM-9120 - Remove local tag used for testing
RDM-9120 - scenarios added for malformed/missing parameters for remove case operation
RDM-9120 - scenarios added for missing/empty case_users list for remove case operation
RDM-9120 - Added S-111.12 FTA negative scenario
RDM-9120 - References to S-111.3, corrected to S-111.13
Counters logic for remove case-user-role scenario
RDM-9120 - Added S-111.14 FTA negative scenario
RDM-9120 -Removed S-111.17 as behaviour is tested in S-111.14
updated counters logic based on flag
RDM-9120 - Added S-111.16 FTA negative scenario
RDM-9120 - filtering case-user-roles which are not exists in the database
RDM-9120 - Added S-111.7 FTA negative scenario
RDM-9120 - V2 - filtering case-user-roles which are not exists in the database
RDM-9120 - Added S-111.15 FTA negative scenario
RDM-9120 - remove case user roles unit tests
RDM-9120 - just trying PRD call with Ola user

nodes.bodyText:
One or both of these functions should to be renamed as :

filterUnknownCauRoles : is filtering OUT unknown CaseRoles: i.e. returns a list EXCLUDING the unknown
filterExistingCauRoles: is filtering ON existing CaseRoles: i.e. returns a list containing ONLY pre-existing CaseRoles
nodes.path: src/main/java/uk/gov/hmcts/ccd/domain/service/caseaccess/CaseAccessOperation.java

nodes.bodyText: If the data types match(?): should this function also be called from inside  getUserCountByCaseAndOrganisation as a replacement for lines 234-239: i.e. the bit with the comment // get distinct list of user ids
nodes.path: src/main/java/uk/gov/hmcts/ccd/domain/service/caseaccess/CaseAccessOperation.java

nodes.bodyText: This code has inherited an unexpected change in order of the Case-User-Roles: i.e. parameter is defined as UserCaseRoles. Should this be renamed?  See also lines 162/163.
nodes.path: src/main/java/uk/gov/hmcts/ccd/ApplicationParams.java

nodes.bodyText: Should this be a reference to F-111_Get_Organisation_Identifier_Hemanth rather than Dil? IGNORE
nodes.path: src/aat/resources/features/F-111 - Remove Case-Assigned Users and Roles/With Organisation Context/common/S-111.13/S-111.13_Repeat_Call_to_Remove_For_Hemanth.td.json
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,32 @@
+{
+  "_guid_": "S-111.13_Repeat_Call_to_Remove_For_Hemanth",
+  "_extends_": "F-111_Remove_Case_Assigned_User_Roles_Base",
+
+  "specs": [
+    "to repeat the same request as above this time with a different user, Hemanth"
+  ],
+
+  "users": {
+    "_extends_": "F-111_Users"
+  },
+
+  "request": {
+    "headers": {
+      "Authorization": "Bearer ${[scenarioContext][testData][users][userDil][accessToken]}"
+    },
+    "body": {
+      "case_users": [
+        {
+          "case_id": "${[scenarioContext][siblingContexts][F-111_Prerequisite_Case_Creation_Call_for_Case_Assignment][testData][actualResponse][body][id]}",
+          "user_id": "${[scenarioContext][testData][users][userHemanth][id]}",
+          "case_role": "[CR-1]",
+          "organisation_id": "${[scenarioContext][siblingContexts][S-111.13_Add_Case_Assigned_User_Roles_for_Case_C1_With_Organisation][childContexts][F-111_Prerequisite_Counter_Check_Call][childContexts][F-111_Get_Organisation_Identifier_Dil][testData][actualResponse][body][organisationIdentifier]}"

nodes.bodyText: Should this be a reference to F-111_Get_Organisation_Identifier_Olawale rather than Dil? IGNORE: it is strange that AC refers only to Dil's organisation without reference to checking Hemanth and Olawale are in same org.
nodes.path: src/aat/resources/features/F-111 - Remove Case-Assigned Users and Roles/With Organisation Context/common/S-111.13/S-111.13.td.json
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,38 @@
+{
+  "title": "Must successfully decrease Assigned User Count when removing a user and case role for a specific case",
+
+  "_guid_": "S-111.13",
+  "_extends_": "F-111_Remove_Case_Assigned_User_Roles_Base",
+
+  "specs": [
+    "Richard - who can create a case",
+    "Dil - who is to add and remove some case role assignment for a case",
+    "Olawale - with an active solicitor profile",
+    "Hemanth - with an active solicitor profile",
+    "is made from an authorised application, by Dil, with the Case ID of C1, User ID of Olawale, proper Case Role CR-1 and the Organisation ID of Olawale"
+  ],
+
+  "users": {
+    "_extends_": "F-111_Users"
+  },
+
+  "request": {
+    "headers": {
+      "Authorization": "Bearer ${[scenarioContext][testData][users][userDil][accessToken]}"
+    },
+    "body": {
+      "case_users": [
+        {
+          "case_id": "${[scenarioContext][childContexts][F-111_Prerequisite_Case_Creation_Call_for_Case_Assignment][testData][actualResponse][body][id]}",
+          "user_id": "${[scenarioContext][testData][users][userOlawale][id]}",
+          "case_role": "[CR-1]",
+          "organisation_id": "${[scenarioContext][childContexts][S-111.13_Add_Case_Assigned_User_Roles_for_Case_C1_With_Organisation][childContexts][F-111_Prerequisite_Counter_Check_Call][childContexts][F-111_Get_Organisation_Identifier_Dil][testData][actualResponse][body][organisationIdentifier]}"

nodes.bodyText: If primary test is adding Ola: Should this be a reference to F-111_Get_Organisation_Identifier_Olawale rather than Dil? IGNORE

nodes.bodyText: Should this not be Dil?
nodes.path: src/aat/resources/features/F-111 - Remove Case-Assigned Users and Roles/With Organisation Context/common/common/F-111_Get_Organisation_Identifier_Dil.td.json

nodes.bodyText: Most/All references in Scenarios's are for Dil: even when roles are being added/removed for other users.  This feels wrong: but it is how most of the ACs are defined.  It may be worth adding an expectedResponse check to two of the three prerequisite files to check all user's are in same org: therefore ensuring the the use of Dil's organisation everywhere is justified: otherwise we may as well have hardcoded a fake Org ID.

+    "F-111_Get_Organisation_Identifier_Dil"

nodes.path: src/aat/resources/features/F-111 - Remove Case-Assigned Users and Roles/Without Organisation Context/S-111.2/S-111.2_Get_Case_Roles_for_Case_C1_AndC2.td.json
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@
+{
+  "title": "Get Case-Assigned Users and Roles",
+
+  "_guid_": "S-111.2_Get_Case_Roles_for_Case_C1_And_C2",
+
+  "productName": "CCD Data Store",
+  "operationName": "Get Case-Assigned Users and Roles",
+
+  "method": "GET",
+  "uri": "/case-users",
+
+  "users": {
+    "invokingUser": {
+      "username": "befta.caseworker.caa@gmail.com",
+      "password": "[[$CCD_BEFTA_CASEWORKER_CAA_PWD]]"
+    }
+  },
+
+  "request": {
+    "_extends_": "Common_Request",
+    "queryParams": {
+      "case_ids": "${}${[scenarioContext][siblingContexts][S-111.2_Add_Case_Assigned_User_Roles_for_Case_C1_And_C2][testData][request][body][case_users][0][case_id]}",
+      "case_ids": "${}${[scenarioContext][siblingContexts][S-111.2_Add_Case_Assigned_User_Roles_for_Case_C1_And_C2][testData][request][body][case_users][1][case_id]}"

commit.message: RDM-9120 - updated to reflect review comments in PR 1045
RDM-9120 - minor cleanup and using user becky to get orgId from PRD
